alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 07 at 4:25AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 730 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 AM HST, radar showed moderate to locally heavy showers developing and moving ashore over the southeast slopes of the Kau and Puna Districts. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hawaiian Paradise Park, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Volcano, Glenwood, Wood Valley, Mountain View, Pahala, Hawaiian Acres, Punaluu Beach, Orchidlands Estates, Kawa Flats, Pahoa, Keaau, Naalehu, Fern Forest, Eden Roc, Fern Acres, Kalapana and Kurtistown. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 730 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
